p: Invasive species are a threat to natural and working lands, including farms and forests, to the integrity of ecosystems in both rural and urban contexts, and to the sustainability of the economic systems that depend on ecosystem services. Losses from invasive species in the United States are estimated at more than US$120 billion annually [ 1, 2]. Yet, these estimates are conservative because they do not include the environmental costs of added management, nor the increased crop losses that these exotic pests may cause [ 3].
